meanings.definition: The soft, spongy tissue in the center of a plant stem.
meanings.sent1: The pith of the stem helps transport water.
meanings.sent2: She carefully removed the pith from the plant stem.
meanings.sent3: The pith bounced like a sponge when squeezed.
meanings.sent4: His words had the pith of truth, simple and direct.
meanings.sent5: The pith, like a cushion, protected the core of the stem.

meanings.definition: The essential or central part of something.
meanings.sent1: The pith of the matter is understanding each other.
meanings.sent2: Her speech lacked the pith needed to inspire the audience.
meanings.sent3: The pith of the joke was lost in translation.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the pith of the problem was revealed at the end.
meanings.sent5: The pith of the song resonated with the listeners.

meanings.definition: To remove the pith from a plant stem.
meanings.sent1: She had to pith the stems before arranging the flowers.
meanings.sent2: He pithed the plant carefully to avoid damaging it.
meanings.sent3: The gardener pithed the stems with precision and skill.
meanings.sent4: Pithing the stems made the flowers easier to work with.
meanings.sent5: The florist pithed the stems swiftly to prepare the bouquet.
